Key Arguments: The legislation increases government and ACMA powers to control free speech on digital platforms.
Governments should not determine what is considered truth or misinformation without open debate.
The legislation sets a dangerous precedent and threatens democracy.
Silencing dissenting voices prevents valuable debate and the potential discovery of truth.
Historical examples show governments have denied truths that later emerged, such as the COVID-19 lab leak theory.
The legislation could stifle scientific debate, as seen in climate change discussions.
The bill could lead to authoritarian governance similar to China and Russia.
Notable Quotes: This is a dangerous & draconian precedent and an attack on our democracy.
Trying to shutting down uncomfortable voices of dissent robs us of a valuable point of view.
I fear that this Bill would be a first and significant step to the establishing and Authoritarian/Totalitarian Government in Australia.
